com.samskivert.depot

Interface SQLFragment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    QueryClause, SQLExpression<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Case, ColumnExp, Distinct, FieldDefinition, FieldOverride, FluentExp, ForUpdate, FromOverride, FullText.Match, FullText.Rank, GroupBy, InsertClause, Join, Key, Key.Expression, KeySet, Limit, OrderBy, SelectClause, Where, WhereClause

    public interface SQLFragment
    Represents a fragment of an SQL statement, generally a clause (WHERE, FROM, ...) or an expression (1+1, 'foo', "columnName", ...).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object accept(com.samskivert.depot.impl.FragmentVisitor<?> visitor)
      Most uses of this class have been implemented with a visitor pattern.
      void addClasses(Collection<Class<? extends PersistentRecord>> classSet)
      Adds all persistent classes that are brought into the SQL context by this clause: FROM clauses, JOINs, UPDATEs, anything that could create a new table abbreviation.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        Object accept(com.samskivert.depot.impl.FragmentVisitor<?> visitor)
        Most uses of this class have been implemented with a visitor pattern. Create your own FragmentVisitor and call this method with it.
        See Also:
        SQLBuilder

      • addClasses

        void addClasses(Collection<Class<? extends PersistentRecord>> classSet)
        Adds all persistent classes that are brought into the SQL context by this clause: FROM clauses, JOINs, UPDATEs, anything that could create a new table abbreviation. This method should recurse into any subordinate state that may in turn bring in new classes so that sub-queries work correctly.
